unnormalised: Okay, here's a comment addressing time zones, incorporating Indian context and unnormalized time data:
normalised: So, last time I was chatting with my cousin Aisha in Dubai, it was a total mess trying to coordinate a call. I was in Mumbai, so it was two thirty P M I-S-T, but for her, it was one P M in the U-A-E. She kept saying, "Call me at seven P M," and I had to keep clarifying if that was *her* seven P M or *my* seven P M! Took us a good ten minutes to figure out the one point five hour time difference. Next time, I’m just going to use a time zone converter and prepone the call instead of going through that again!

unnormalised: So, last time I was chatting with my cousin Aisha in Dubai, it was a total mess trying to coordinate a call. I was in Mumbai, so it was 2:30 PM IST, but for her, it was 1:00 PM in the UAE. She kept saying, "Call me at 7 PM," and I had to keep clarifying if that was *her* 7 PM or *my* 7 PM! Took us a good 10 mins to figure out the 1.5 hr time diff. Next time, I’m just going to use a time zone converter and prepone the call instead of going thru that again!
